str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(lit: blunted) dumb, dull, deaf. From kopto; blunted, i.e. of hearing or speech.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Never. From oude and pote; not even at any time, i.e. Never at all.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Prolongation for the base of phos; to lighten, i.e. Show.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.
